Reviews.Title: Fantastic drive for TiVo HD! Very quiet!
Reviews.Author: Math Man "Math182"
Reviews.Content: To increase the capacity of my TiVo HD I replaced the 160 GB drive with a 1 TB WD10EARS.  I love this drive!  It is very quiet which is great because I use my TiVo HD in my bedroom!My PC is old and doesn't have SATA ports.  I connect SATA drives to my PC with a "Syba USB 3.0 to SATA Docking Station for 2.5-Inch and 3.5-Inch Hard Drives SD-ENC50037" (see link below).  It supports USB 3.0 and is backward compatible to USB 1.1 and 2.0 in case your computer is old like mine and doesn't have USB 3.0 ports.  It works great!  Unlike another USB SATA Docking Station I tried previously which caused drives to overheat, this one does not confine drives very much and so runs much cooler.  It does require some manipulation to install the drive in the docking station, however.  I highly recommend this docking station over the other one which costs about $6 to $8 more.Syba USB 3.0 to SATA Docking Station for 2.5-Inch and 3.5-Inch Hard Drives SD-ENC50037Following are the steps I used to upgrade my TiVo HD:Download WinMFS software from InternetConnect USB SATA Docking Station to USB port on PCInsert original SATA drive from TiVo HD into slot of Docking StationTurn on Docking StationAfter you hear drive spin up, start WinMFS softwareFile / Select Drive (select original TiVo drive)File / Backup (create truncated backup)Select Backup File: assign a name to the backup fileClick Start ButtonWhen backup is finished, exit WinMFSUse "Safely Remove Hardware" in lower right hand control panel to remove Docking Station and installed driveTurn off Docking Station and remove driveReplace original drive by replacement SATA drive in slot on USB SATA Docking StationWait until drive spins up then launch WinMFSFile / Select Drive / select the new replacement SATA driveTools / Delete Format (IMPORTANT STEP)File / Restore / select truncated file in "HD Backup Files" folderClick Start (to restore TiVo image onto new drive)DO NOT CHANGE THE SWAP SIZE! LEAVE IT AT DEFAULT 128Say YES when restore is complete and WinMFS asks if you want to expand the drive to use the new spaceExit WinMFSTurn off the USB SATA adapter and remove drive from adapter

Reviews.Title: Great Moxi Hard Drive Replacement
Reviews.Author: SIL777
Reviews.Content: My Moxi was beginning to give me problems so I did some research and found the Official Moxi Hard Drive Replacement thread on the AVS Forums. If I had an account with them my post would go like this.Moxi three tunerInternal ReplacementSUCCESSMy Moxi had the following symptoms. Picture would freeze then it would starting up again or error out. Picture would pixilate. Network icons would disappear and later reappear. All recorded shows at times would get dumped by the Moxi after rebooting.  Moxi would show no signal present when it actually was present.Replaced original Moxi hard drive with this Western Digital hard drive (WD10EURX).  Never removed the CableCard. I was able to do the four finger press with the Moxi connected to my LAN. Read some users had to connect straight to their modem which was not the case for me. Maybe because I have a reserved IP for my Moxi. The Moxi must have internet access for this procedure to work. The four finger press brought up the reformatting screen in about 25 seconds. I selected yes for the process to begin. Took no more than 40 minutes to complete. Once completed Moxi asked a few basic questions like it did when I first set it up new. When I got to the program guide it took a few minutes to load (so don't panic). After that all was functioning properly.I made a note of my channels and the shows I record. This information had to be enter in again and the notes made the process easier. The hard drive is quiet. Never had to reset the CableCard all my channels worked again without having to call my cable company. Three weeks later and all is well. I have already order the same hard drive just to have a backup on hand.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Drive for Tivo HD
Reviews.Author: BertMan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this drive as a replacement for a failing 750 gig Seagate DB35.  I had been getting corrupted recordings, and random reboots on my Tivo HD for several weeks, so found my way into the HD diagnostics menu (kickstart code 54) and found that the HD was getting bad sectors.  Unfortunately, this is because Tivo in their infinite wisdom, buffers live video to the HD 24/7, so after 4 years, this HD was dying.I backed up my recordings (all 600+ GB worth) onto my PC, performed a truncated backup, restored the backup to the new drive, and replaced the failing drive with this WD 1 TB drive.  And unlike earlier WD drives that I'd read about, this one did not require any adjustments to the spin down function.Once the Tivo ran some mysterious tests on the new drive for 3+ hours, it came right up.  It now shows 157 HD hours available on the new drive.Just last night, I stress tested the new drive by recording 2 HD programs, transferred a third back from my PC and watched a fourth HD prerecorded program - that's 4 HD streams at once.  It performed without any problems.

Reviews.Title: This hard drive works great in Tivo Series 3 DVRs
Reviews.Author: Cactus Head
Reviews.Content: Purchased two of these to upgrade my Tivo Series 3 units.  Drives work great in the Tivos.  No issues with the power-save options or head parking options as with earlier western digital dvr drives.  This drive does not require any adjustments prior to using with a tivo.  Earlier WD drives needed some options set with the wdidle utility (at the WD web site).This drive is plug and play.  After copying the Tivo OS over to drives, the Tivos came right up.  No issues with hanging on rebooting (as seen with earlier versions of WD DVR drives).  Tivo does cold and warm reboots without issues.  Running rock solid now for three weeks.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Drive for a Tivo HD Upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Ken A. Collins
Reviews.Content: My TiVo HD DVR got to the point where I often found recorded shows in pieces because the darn thing rebooted itself in the middle of recording, leaving me with two recordings and a 12 minute gap in between (for one hour shows).  Its frequent reboots interrupted viewing.  Researching online, it became clear to me that the hard drive was dying.After finding instructions online at Engadget and TiVoCommunity for how to replace the hard drive and transfer all my recordings from the original TiVo hard drive, I was all set to buy a Seagate drive.  Then I learned that there actually is a difference among drives, and this Western Digital AV-GP WD10EURX one is designed for DVRs.  While I might not think much of a noisy Seagate drive in my computer, I don't want a noisy hard drive in an appliance in my living room.  According to a TiVoCommunity forum posting, WD AV-GP drives rate a 10 on a scale of 1 to 10 where 10 is the quietest.Also, these drives are designed for continuous operation 24/7 with the intent that the data they are moving is video that you are watching, so they don't split up the bytes and move them in the random ways that regular data gets transferred.One concern I had is that the original TiVo HD 160 GB drive ran at 5400 rpm and this new WD10EURX 1 TB drive runs at 7200 rpm so would the faster drive get hotter and since the TiVo HD was only designed to cool the 5400 rpm drive, would this be a problem?  The answer is no.  These WD AV-GP drives are "green" emitting low heat so they can easily replace the original drive without an issue.The TiVoCommunity forum posting was last updated about 5 years ago, so its description of running WinMFS, the required tool for preparing hard drives for TiVo usage, only goes up to Windows Vista, so I can add that it works with Windows 7, just right-click on WinMFS.exe and run as administrator.The forum posting warns against WD AV-GP drives saying that they can't be rebooted and will just hang.  The only solution then is to unplug the power cord in the back of the TiVo and then plug it back in.  This is no longer true.  Western Digital must have heard about the problem and fixed it, because I was able to use the restart option from the TiVo menu to test this, and sure enough, the TiVo restarted.  I did not need to unplug and replug the unit.  I did not need to run the wdidle3 workaround program.After the upgrade, I went from 21 HD / 184 SD hours recording capacity to 157 HD / 1,367 SD hours.  Plus, all my recordings transferred from the old drive to the new one since I ran the MFSCOPY command via the WinMFS GUI.Below are some URLs where I pieced together the information to perform the upgrade (I hope these links remain in my comments, not sure if Amazon will remove them):http://www.tivocommunity.com/tivo-vb/showthread.php?t=370784#S5http://www.engadget.com/2008/04/17/how-to-upgrade-your-tivo-hd-with-winmfs/

Reviews.Title: Fantastic DVR Drive!
Reviews.Author: Doug "tech guy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this drive to replace a faulty Seagate Pipeline drive in my Moxi 3-Tuner DVR.  After installation and downloading of the Moxi software I noticed that the Moxi performed much better.  Menus loaded quicker and remote commands had less delay.  The drive seems much more quiet as well.  It is a fantastic drive which I would purchase again.

Reviews.Title: My TiVo is Alive again !!
Reviews.Author: Todd Galle
Reviews.Content: My Tivo is alive again !!!  After a lot of research, it looks like replacing a Tivo hard drive will fix most problems you're having with the Tivo.  It definitely fixed mine.  My Tivo has been pixelating, having bad audio, restarting on its own, etc for about a year now.  I feel stupid for not spending less than $75 for fixing it sooner.  There are instructions online to help you transfer from your old to Tivo to the new drive.  I used the instructions found here:  [...]  It was so simple.  If your Tivo isn't acting right, or you just want to increase your recording times, get this drive.

Reviews.Title: Nice Hard drive for Moxi Dvr
Reviews.Author: P. Phillips
Reviews.Content: My Moxi 3-tuner Dvr hard drive finally went bad. From the tips from the Avs Forums,Moxi replacement thread. Decided to try this hard drive. Went in very easy, it took a couple of tries to get the software to install. After about 1/2hr of download everything was working. It is running a lot better now,playback is smoother.Switching channels is faster,and the hard drive runs quieter. Also I prefer WD drives to seagate anyways,I have 3 WD in my computer now.

Reviews.Title: Delete as many saved shows as possible FIRST
Reviews.Author: Bumbler
Reviews.Content: Transfer to PC or a second TiVo any saved shows you "can't live without", then Delete EVERYTHING ELSE but your Season Passes. Be sure and Permanently Delete ANYTHING in the Recently Deleted Folder as well. This will reduce the Drive Image to as little as 500MB and speed up the Clone operation to less than 5 minutes using a USB Drive Adapter! If you have a DVR Expander be sure to Disconnect it first and let TiVo re-configure itself for a single drive BEFORE doing anything. When done, Toss the DVR Expander, you won't need it anymore. My TiVo HD is reporting 142 Hours HD or 1241 Hours SD from this single Drive following Math Man review instructions for WinMFS software. Worked Perfectly in minutes, saved all my Season Passes and Channel lists. The few Movies I wanted to keep I saved to a second TiVo first. The less on your Hard Drive the Better, Delete as many shows as possible!

Reviews.Title: Great TIVO Replacement Drive
Reviews.Author: GAP
Reviews.Content: I used this drive to replace my 160 GB drive in the TIVO HD. Increased my recording hours from 21 to 150+. Followed the instructions on the tivocommunity.com site using the winmfs software. It was quick and easy and works great.

Reviews.Title: Great so far.....
Reviews.Author: Duck05
Reviews.Content: Purchased this drive to replace a failed 500Mb drive in a Moxi DVR.  Easy swap and install and after 4 weeks so far the drive is performing  well.The DVR places a lot of demands on the drive as it records up to 3 streams at a time and supports watching a 4th pre recorded listing.  Even when not recording, the active channel being watched is recorded to allow for skipping back on demand (as does most DVRs).

Reviews.Title: Great Drive for DVR Applications
Reviews.Author: S. S. Eliot
Reviews.Content: I purchased two of these drives to replace 3 year old Seagate drives that were failing in both of my MOXI DVR's.  These drives are quiet and run cool which is great for DVR operation.  Highly recommend these drives (or their 2TB version) for any MOXI or TIVO owner that needs to upgrade their HD.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: S. Camarao "shrimpster"
Reviews.Content: Its only been some weeks since I had this but since replacing an older Samsung HD for recording TV on my HTPC with Infinitv4 tuner, I have not had 1 recording or Live TV issue.  Everything is running smoothly.  There are occasional hiccups in the recording but where in the past the file would get corrupted or the computer would stop recording, now I get some pixelation but the show records.

Reviews.Title: Price was right
Reviews.Author: SluggoMagoo
Reviews.Content: This is a DVR quality drive for a nice price. I installed one in my Zmodo DVR and it works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: D. R. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: WORKS GOOD FOR DVR SECURITY SYSTEM, NO PROBLEMS RUNS COOL AND IS QUITE, WOULD BUY AGAIN, BUT THIS TIME I`LL WILL BUY THE 2 TB MODEL FOR MORE ROOM FOR VIDEO.........

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I needed
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: This item was easy to locate online when I was making a DVD purchase. It was exactly what I needed. Work excellent. Packaging was flawless. Easy to install and format.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TiVo Premiere Upgrade, easy and painless!
Reviews.Author: Bobby D
Reviews.Content: Our TiVo Premiere has started having some problems the past few months: random reboots, lock ups, glitches in the recordings, etc. When it hung up while my wife was watching one of her favorite shows and finally responded a few minutes later in the recording, I started to consider that the hard drive may be failing. It just seemed like the box was trying to read part of the disk and having failures, eventually moved on to a part of the disk it could read. I did some research on how to check the hard drive from the diagnostics menu, and sure enough, the test had failures almost immediately.After talking to TiVo about my options on getting the hard drive replaced ($350: $150 for a refurbished TiVo Premiere and $200 to transfer my Lifetime subscription) I decided to look into doing it myself. Do yourself a favor and search for "Ross Walker's Guide to Upgrading your TiVo" on the internet. Ross has captured, in exhaustive detail, the process of upgrading hard drives in most of the various TiVo models out there. Following his instructions was extremely easy and for the cost of a new drive and a couple of Torx screwdrivers, my TiVo Premiere continues to keep on working and now has triple the original recording capacity.As with all of my hard drive reviews, I will update if and when the drive fails. However, so far, so good!

Reviews.Title: A/V model
Reviews.Author: MAGstar
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to use on a HTPC. I don't know what makes this different from the data model, but it works well and it is silent.

Reviews.Title: Ultra reliable hard disk
Reviews.Author: Tommy Tucker "Tommy Tucker"
Reviews.Content: Because this series of WD disks is made to operate in high temperature environments such as video recorders it should last longer than a typical hard disk, and based on many reviews by others on several sites it seems to be delivering the goods for a comparable price as a conventional disk.  For this advantage the sole disadvantage for some applications is that the access time is a little slower than, say, an internal system disk, but that's a small price to pay for most other applications where speed is more dependent on continuous read or write times.  I also note there are other models up to at least 4 TB at reasonable prices.  Access time is the only reason for the four stars rather than five.

Reviews.Title: Works great in TiVo HD
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Following the other positive reviews about this drive for TiVo HD, I successfully changed the hard drive in my TiVo HD to this WD10EURX. Very pleased with the price, compatibility, and low noise.  Glad the head parking feature is turned off because I do not have the ability to run the app for that. Just ran the MFSLive tool.

Reviews.Title: Perfect TiVO HDD replacement
Reviews.Author: J. M. Lowe
Reviews.Content: Used this to replace the 160GB drive in my TiVO HD. HD recordable hours up from 23 to 120. Easy install, worked exactly as expected. These drives are apparently purpose-built low-energy drives for DVRs. Not sure I can confirm that from actual use, but it certainly works as I hoped.

Reviews.Title: quiet and heat free
Reviews.Author: chente
Reviews.Content: runs quiet and heat free, both good for use in a DVR, records well, no issues at all, good warranty also

Reviews.Title: Excellent for Home Theater PC
Reviews.Author: southleft
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these from a different online retailer about a year ago. It works great and runs very quietly. We record from two to five one-hour TV shows almost every day of the week. Also some longer programs such as movies or football games. After watching, we delete most of the recordings and save only a few. So, this hard drive is getting plenty of use and has not had a single problem so far. Another benefit is that we can record 3 programs at once while we are watching a program we recorded earlier, and everything goes smoothly - no glitches, no stuttering or hanging.

Reviews.Title: Worked perfect in Tivo Series 3000
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "quiksr20"
Reviews.Content: This worked perfect in my Tivo Series 3000 adn was the most highly recomended drive when following repair guides.The best guide I found was here - http://www.rosswalker.co.uk/tivo_upgrade/It was incredibly easy to do.

Reviews.Title: Worked perfectly
Reviews.Author: Leslie C. Hand
Reviews.Content: Used with a night owl security system - a cinch to install - no issues at all.  Comes in a great anti static bag

Reviews.Title: Perfect for DVRs
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I bought four of these hard drives for a security system DVRs and they work flawlessly could not beat the price

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: Jay Common "Bub"
Reviews.Content: I Re-did one of my E-Machines EL-1352 07e . I installed this new hard-drive in it, and then I downloaded a bunch of updates on it and I tested it out and it was working good. So, I keep that PC in my closet as a 'back-up' in case the PC I have now breaks down.Of course, if you want to do that, you need to have some 'recovery disks'. You could order them online possibly for your PC model if you don't have some.You know, after a while these PC's break down, and often all you really need is a new 'hard drive' like this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Installed this product in my DVR, tons of storage space...I am only running one camera, on high resolution....I have my DVR set to record on motion, in a month I have used 13% of my hard drive space..at that rate, I will record about 9 months of video before it over writes. Easy install...pretty much plug and play, it did require that I format, but that is typical.

Reviews.Title: Fast and cool
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: These are running in a server room, so I have no idea how quiet they are. However, they definitely run very cool, which is excellent and appreciated. They also seem to be quite fast. Running a block-level copy of several hundred gigabytes from some older SATA drivers (in an array that should boost read speed) to two of these drives in RAID 1 (which should hurt write speed), these drives were nearly "bored" waiting for the older drives to dish up the data.

Reviews.Title: Good Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: Edw
Reviews.Content: I got this for a security camera system, it installed very easily and has been working good since I got it. I have been recording 2 cameras for 30 days and still have 110 meg still available.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tivo Upgrade option
Reviews.Author: craig Longenecker
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent choice if you want to add more life and/or capacity to your Tivo DVR.  After reading all of the horror stories regarding incompatible drives being installed in the Tivo DVR I was very pleased to have the Tivo recognize this drive right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: John Hughes
Reviews.Content: Great hard drive for my storage needs to go along with my solid state.  Best price found on the web.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Working flawlessly.
Reviews.Author: Bill E.
Reviews.Content: Bought for my security system. Just plugged it in & formatted. It has been recording flawlessly for over 6 weeks now

Reviews.Title: The WD AV-GP 1 TB made my old AV recorder work like new!!
Reviews.Author: Richard3510
Reviews.Content: It's an old TIVO but it now works like new.After many years of use my TIVO started to respond slowly, but it was out of warranty.  The only moving part is the HDD, so I took a chance and replaced it with the WD AV-GP 1 TB, 64 MB Cache.  The TIVO works like new or better; it has been a long time and I just do not remember how it ran when new.  This HDD almost did not fit in the case, I had to install it upside down.  The WD AV-GP 1 TB runs silent, no vibration, no clicks.I chose this HDD because of the large Cache, low Amazon price and the "drive leveling".  I realize that there is a large unused partition, the TIVO still has the same amount of recording space.  If I could have found a 200 GB HDD with the same specifications and lower price I would have bought it.

Reviews.Title: Quiet and does the job!
Reviews.Author: HC in NC "oldguy66"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this HDD for my new Home Theater PC build.  It had great ratings, superior to the Blue or Red models.  I use it to store the TV shows I save (I'm too cheap to pay Time Warner for a DVR) on my HTPC.  It's only been a month since I installed it but I like Western Digital and have had luck with their HDDs for many years.  Check out the reviews here and on other sites to satisfy yourself, but I think it's a good product.

Reviews.Title: Working great in my TiVo Romio
Reviews.Author: John M. Bissell
Reviews.Content: Title pretty much says it all. I replaced the stock 500GB drive in my new Roamio with this drive in about 15 minutes. The latest TiVos, the Roamio series, are incredibly easy to upgrade. The OS is stored in flash so you just remove the cover, pull out the old drive, plug in the new drive, reassemble, and you're up and running in minutes. Note that you will lose your Season Passes and saved recordings if you don't back them up prior to upgrading.The drive is silent and I've always had great reliability w/ WD drives. The WD Green drive in my older TiVo ran for five years w/o a problem.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Sokiokira
Reviews.Content: This is what I wanted now my surveillance can record when I am not at home I am so glad I got it fast otherwise I would not feel good leaving the house

Reviews.Title: works
Reviews.Author: forenzic
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a home surveillance system, all i had to do was formatted it to the unit and this works and holds a lot of footage. awesome

Reviews.Title: failure
Reviews.Author: J. Freeman
Reviews.Content: Bought to use in Zmodo system and it would not format.Dvr would never recognize the hard drive. returned for refund.

Reviews.Title: Great For Security Camera Dvr!
Reviews.Author: sammy toke
Reviews.Content: I bought a zmodo H.264 Dvr. and installed this hard drive its Super quiet and it stays very cool. It can store about a month of video from 8 600TVL cameras :)

Reviews.Title: Great drive for us in a DVR or other continuous operation device.
Reviews.Author: BoFiS
Reviews.Content: This drive was bought in order to repair and upgrade our TiVo DVR and we have not had any issues with it since installing it into the TiVo.  It runs 24/7 and is constantly recording and playing back simultaneous HD streams.

Reviews.Title: Replaced 250 GB HD in DTVPal DVR
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Replaced 250 GB HD in DTVPal DVR.  This is a green Hard drive and works right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: wd av-gp 1TB
Reviews.Author: John   Hatten
Reviews.Content: Just what I wanted to go into my TiVo. Thanks to amazon for fast shipping so that I could upgrade my TiVo to record more shows on it.

Reviews.Title: it works that is all i expect...
Reviews.Author: airgas1998
Reviews.Content: bought this several months ago for 91.00 and now it's 66.00 thanks amazon. anyway just now installed it in my cm dvr works great. had a hiccup about a month in, but reformatted the hdd and all is well.

Reviews.Title: Solid drive
Reviews.Author: S. Brazile
Reviews.Content: These drives are dead quiet and have a very long life expectancy.  Love them!  Could not be happier, thanks from a happy customer!

Reviews.Title: Western Digital Hard drive
Reviews.Author: Karen Ramjit
Reviews.Content: Initially the zmodo DVR system we hooked it up, won't boot up but then it did.  It worked well for about 2 weeks and now it won't start again.  So not sure if its the hard drive or the Zmodo DVR system.  Have to get it looked at

Reviews.Title: Media Server storage
Reviews.Author: T. Sellhorn
Reviews.Content: I got this drive to work as a dedicated storage for Plex.  I have only had the drive for a short time, but am thoroughly satisfied.  Its fast and quiet, it does not impact my other processes while people are streaming off the drive.  I highly suggest this drive, and recommend going to the 2TB or greater if you think it may be necessary

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT - QUIET!
Reviews.Author: Binary Spin
Reviews.Content: Have had for over one month in a windows media center PC, recording from Silicondust tuner. This drive is VERY quiet (can't even hear it) and has no problem streaming high def to more than one device at a time. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great upgrade for a Tivo Series 2
Reviews.Author: Christopher Bell
Reviews.Content: I purchased this drive as a replacement for a 80GB HHD that went bad in my sisters Tivo. The Tivo now has a recording capacity of over 1,200 hours. The drive works great and is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Dave.
Reviews.Content: I use this for my ZMODO security survalance system and the install was very easy.  It works and records fine.  No problems for several months.

Reviews.Title: Good Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: blurb
Reviews.Content: Used for Security DVR'S so far working great, Has been installed for over two months now and still working only time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Hard drive
Reviews.Author: Donald Johnson
Reviews.Content: very good product and the way it is shipped is the best i have seen in package than in foam carers in a box  well packaged i do it 5 Stars plus some and clear video its well worth it for price

Reviews.Title: Great Product !
Reviews.Author: dsterbd
Reviews.Content: I'm not too much of a techie but I put this into a Tivo after cloning the old drive and it worked perfectly. Very quiet and a great fit for anyone wanting to upgrade or repair their old Tivo drive.

Reviews.Title: video hard drive it is.
Reviews.Author: NJ tradesman
Reviews.Content: Had to purchase this hard drive for extra recording space on security camera system.  Did not know there was a difference between video hard drives and Pc hard drives.  Now I know, and happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect upgrade for my Tivo S3
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Installed without issue and just works.  I wanted a quiet and energy conscious replacement for my old and too small hard drive.  This was recommended for a Tivo and I'm happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Great Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: DrHankZ "TransAm Racer"
Reviews.Content: Allowed me to upgrade TiVo to 300+ Hoursof Hi-Def Recording Capacity. The AV modelis needed for 24x7 recording.

Reviews.Title: WD AV-GP 1 TB AV Hard Drive: 3.5 Inch, SATA III, 64 MB Cache - WD10EURX  - So far, so good
Reviews.Author: kevinsc1
Reviews.Content: I purchased this hard drive for a DVR as the WD AV-GP was recommended by the manufacturer.  So far it is working just fine.  With the 5400 RPM speed, this was the best choice for the job of continuous read/writes.

Reviews.Title: Works great with TiVo
Reviews.Author: mm
Reviews.Content: Upgraded drive in my TiVo and it works fabulously. I totally would get it again. Lots of extra space now.

Reviews.Title: Good replacement for my Qsee DVR
Reviews.Author: Xamos
Reviews.Content: It showed up literally the next day.  I unpacked it and slid it into my DVR, formatted it and whalla, recording surveillance video :-) Happy Me

Reviews.Title: DVD drive and works
Reviews.Author: JohnnyRed
Reviews.Content: Taped when I wanted what more to say. Put it in a cheap securty sysetm and it works enough said.

Reviews.Title: Effortless replacement for dead Seagate.
Reviews.Author: Rob Meadows
Reviews.Content: Touch wood - seems to be working just fine.  Bought to replace dead Seagate which lost boot sector.  Used backup DVDs to format and reinstall OS.

Reviews.Title: not sure of product yet ,but will write on next one recieve and install.
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL GREER
Reviews.Content: it stop working with in 30days but I have reorder another one to see how well it perform. I just believe. in second chance on this item.it did work well on my dvr . but sad for how money I will be losing.

Reviews.Title: Fast, quiet -- so far so good
Reviews.Author: Krell
Reviews.Content: Installed these into a Windows 7 HTPC build.  So far so good.  The Windows Experience score is as high as my 2 year-old SSD in my gaming laptop, and boot time is nice and quick.  No complaints on this one!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Green Drive out there!
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find out what is the best secondary hard drive to get for data storage.  This drive is it!This drive has a 5 year warranty where as the other green drives are 2.1,000,000 hours MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures) where as the other drives are not rated with a MTBF.Sata III is very fast and even faster on windows 7 and 8 compared to XP.I have mine in front of a fan and its never hot to the touch even under a big load and stays very quiet.The only con is these kind of drives only come in 1 TB so you will have to buy more and raid them if you want larger storage.Other than that this will be the most reliable green drive you can get for $100 well worth the peace of mind for me!

Reviews.Title: Great value for a large quite drive
Reviews.Author: wayne
Reviews.Content: I ordered the WD 1TB HD to replace a failed Seagate. The HD arrived quickly, installed in a few minutes and is dead silent. It runs like a champ. I haven't any issues since the installation about 3 weeks back. Be warned, you may need to purchase some software to clone or format your new drive. I tried to recover from a CD and the software wouldn't recognize the new disk. I purchased Acronis Migrate Easy and had a complete clone of my old malfunctioning disk in a few hours.I recommend this route for speed and easy of use. Well worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: WD A/V Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a replacement to a dead drive in my HD DVR.  Replaced a much smaller 320 GB hard drive.  The drive worked perfectly as expected from Western Digital products.  It is very quiet and having the extra storage is great.  Amazon's price was excellent.  I would recommend this or the 2 TB WD A/V drive if you are looking to replace your A/V device hard drive. I would not use this drive for PC use.

Reviews.Title: Great Hard drive
Reviews.Author: R. Sharma
Reviews.Content: I installed this in my Tivo, my Tivo has only restarted 1 time in the past 3 weeks, Very quiet, quieter than the stock 160 gb hard drive.

Reviews.Title: Works great in a TiVo Premier
Reviews.Author: D. Adler
Reviews.Content: Used this drive to upgrade a TiVo Premier, and have a backup of the original system disk.  Works as expected. Quiet as the original drive.

Reviews.Title: solid device
Reviews.Author: RobA
Reviews.Content: Not a lot to say about a disk drive. This one went in a surveillance system. It was easy to install and has been working fine.

Reviews.Title: dvr hard drive
Reviews.Author: chuck
Reviews.Content: got this for a security camera set up, didn't know that you could not use just a computor hd, but had to have an a/v hard drive. since I got it it works great for dvr secuirity camera set up. can bring up the recorded video when someone trips the auto movement recording.

Reviews.Title: DVR hard drive
Reviews.Author: Joseph Valenta
Reviews.Content: I needed this hard drive for my video servallance system and this was perfect.it came in on time and was a perfect fit and works like a champ

Reviews.Title: Great DVR Drive
Reviews.Author: Craig K. Gerlach "Sobitthen"
Reviews.Content: Bought for my security system per recommendations on the web.Have not installed it yet, expect to have many years of service and reduced noise volumes and power usage as with my other WD green drives.

Reviews.Title: WD AV-GP 1 TB AV Video Hard Drive: 3.5 Inch, SATA III, 64 MB Cache -...
Reviews.Author: jesse
Reviews.Content: Western Digital told me the warranty had expired 3 days after I received drivechecked with Western Digital and was told there was no warranty on this drive

Reviews.Title: yea
Reviews.Author: bbcg
Reviews.Content: this drive runs much cooler than previous purchase of previous for external hard drive cover wish had gotten first now going to use in HTPC build

ProductInfo.Features:
Power-conserving WD AV-GP drives offer significant power savings and thermally optimized operation resulting in lower cost of ownership and unsurpassed reliability for PVR/DVR, IPTV boxes and media server manufacturers.
SilkStream - Optimized for smooth, continuous digital video playback of up to twelve simultaneous HD streams. SilkStream is compatible with the ATA streaming command set so CE customers can use standard streaming management and error recovery options.
Ideal for set-top boxes (PVR, DVR and IPTV), media servers, media centers, and surveillance applications.
1 TB capacity holds up to 200,000 digital photos, 250,000 MP3 files, and 120 hours of HD video.
ProductInfo.Name: WD AV-GP 1 TB AV Video Hard Drive: 3.5 Inch, SATA III, 64 MB Cache - WD10EURX
